Sentencas: Barium strontium cobaltite-ferrite (Ba1-xSrxCoyFe1-yO3-delta, BSCF) is a widely studied mixed ionic-electronic conductor material for air electrode in solid oxide cells (SOC).
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: Despite having excellent features, due to fast oxygen surface exchange and oxygen bulk diffusion, it lacks long-term stability.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: Electrode/electrolyte thermal expansion coefficient (TEC) mismatch and structural instability at temperature lower than 900 degrees C are responsible for the increase of electrode polarization which becomes a crucial issue for the long-term stability.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: In this work, SOC stability was studied by adding a thin porous samarium-doped ceria (SDC) backbone on top of the dense SDC electrolyte.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: The porous SDC backbone was then infiltrated by precursor nitrates to obtain a Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe3-delta composition.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: The SEM investigation showed a nano-sized BSCF-based layer covering the backbone structure.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: In addition, symmetrical cells were studied in the 400-700 degrees C temperature range and under anodic and cathodic polarization showing unexpected behavior associated to the electrode microstructure.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: The modified electrode synergistically enhanced ORR and OER by showing no oxygen vacancies clustering which induces a higher polarization resistance.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: Ageing procedure was performed for over 120 h at 600 degrees C under switched current load of +/- 0.2 A cm(-2).
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode

Sentencas: The prepared system showed high stability coupled with remarkable electrocatalytic performance and good mechanical properties.
Titulo: Impregnation of microporous SDC scaffold as stable solid oxide cell BSCF-based air electrode
